entries.name: RCS Thruster
entries.description: Standard, low-power thruster for station-keeping and maneuvering. Simple and reliable, but 'sips' fuel.

entries.name: Methalox Engine (Raptor-class)
entries.description: High-thrust, high-performance chemical engine. Ideal for launch, landing, and combat burns. A 'brute force' engine.

entries.name: Ion Drive (NEXIS-class)
entries.description: Extremely low thrust, but incredible fuel efficiency. Useless in an atmosphere and requires a large power plant to run.

entries.name: Nuclear Thermal (NTR)
entries.description: Uses a fission reactor to superheat hydrogen. The classic 'torch ship' drive. A great balance of thrust and efficiency.

entries.name: Fusion Torch (Epstein-class)
entries.description: The ultimate sci-fi 'workhorse' drive. Constant-thrust, high-G burns are possible. Can cross a solar system in days or weeks. Requires a fusion reactor.

entries.name: Antimatter Beam-Core
entries.description: Theoretical drive with performance that approaches the impossible. Requires a 'reaction mass' (like hydrogen) and massive power for containment.

entries.name: Alcubierre Warp Drive
entries.description: Does not provide 'thrust'. Consumes exotic matter to warp spacetime, enabling FTL travel. Requires a massive power plant and conventional drives for in-system maneuvering.
